markdown:
**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 327 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Bloodline** [Elemental](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=24) **Deities** [Magrim](/Deities.aspx?ID=450), [Treasures Of The Eternal Delve](/Deities.aspx?ID=374), [Zevgavizeb](/Deities.aspx?ID=442) **Range** 500 feet **Area** 60-foot burst **Duration** 1 round --- You shake the ground, topple creatures into fissures, and collapse structures. The GM might add additional effects in certain areas. Cliffs might collapse, causing creatures to fall, or a lake might drain as fissures open up below its surface, leaving a morass of quicksand.
  • **Shaking Ground** The ground is [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453), and creatures on it take a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, AC, and skill checks.
  • **Fissures** Each creature on the ground must attempt a Reflex save at the start of its turn to keep its footing and avoid falling into 40-foot-deep fissures that open beneath it. The fissures are permanent, and their sides require successful DC 15 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) checks to [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=33).
  • **Collapse** Structures and ceilings might collapse. The GM rolls a flat check for each (DC 16 for a sturdy structure, DC 14 for an average structure and most natural formations, DC 9 for a shoddy structure, all adjusted higher or lower as the GM sees fit). A collapse deals 11d6 bludgeoning damage to each creature caught in it with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. A creature falls [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) unless it critically succeeds and falls into a fissure if it critically fails.
--- **Heightened (10th)** You create a massive earthquake that can devastate a settlement. The range increases to half a mile and the area to a quarter-mile burst.
name: Earthquake

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 500 feet

**Area** 60-foot burst

 
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>
</additional-info>

---

<summary>
Shake the ground with a devastating earthquake.
</summary>
summary: Shake the ground with a devastating earthquake.
summary_markdown: Shake the ground with a devastating earthquake.
text: Earthquake Two Actions Source Player Core pg. 327 2.0 Traditions Arcane, Primal Bloodline Elemental Deities Magrim, Treasures Of The Eternal Delve, Zevgavizeb Range 500 feet Area 60-foot burst Duration 1 round --- You shake the ground, topple creatures into fissures, and collapse structures. The GM might add additional effects in certain areas. Cliffs might collapse, causing creatures to fall, or a lake might drain as fissures open up below its surface, leaving a morass of quicksand. Shaking Ground The ground is difficult terrain, and creatures on it take a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, AC, and skill checks. Fissures Each creature on the ground must attempt a Reflex save at the start of its turn to keep its footing and avoid falling into 40-foot-deep fissures that open beneath it. The fissures are permanent, and their sides require successful DC 15 Athletics checks to Climb. Collapse Structures and ceilings might collapse. The GM rolls a flat check for each (DC 16 for a sturdy structure, DC 14 for an average structure and most natural formations, DC 9 for a shoddy structure, all adjusted higher or lower as the GM sees fit). A collapse deals 11d6 bludgeoning damage to each creature caught in it with a basic Reflex save. A creature falls prone unless it critically succeeds and falls into a fissure if it critically fails. --- Heightened (10th) You create a massive earthquake that can devastate a settlement. The range increases to half a mile and the area to a quarter-mile burst.
